Sinister, devoid of warmth, with a slight, eerie resonance.): 'The beans, dark as a forgotten secret, were ground by hand in a stone mortar, each turn of the pestle a whispered syllable of a forbidden incantation. He did not use water from the tap, but rainwater collected during a thunderstorm, now brought to a boil over a single, unwavering flame. As the steam curled into sigils in the still air, he made the offering—a sliver of a happy memory, a wisp of yesterday’s laughter, given up to the void. Then, it began. A single, perfect drop of liquid midnight fell from the filter into the waiting porcelain cup. It was not a brew, but a summoning. He raised the cup, the aroma alone a jolt of pure, cosmic energy that promised to rewrite the day. The universe snapped into focus with the first sip, but in the corner of his eye, a shadow detached itself from the wall, a little deeper and hungrier than it had been before. --------------------------------
